parameters.jsonBody:
={
  "video_url": "{{ $json.response }}",
  "settings": {
    "line_color": "#FFFFFF",
    "word_color": "#66ff74",
    "all_caps": false,
    "max_words_per_line": 3,
    "font_size": 60,
    "bold": false,
    "italic": false,
    "underline": false,
    "strikeout": false,
    "outline_width": 3,
    "shadow_offset": 4,
    "style": "highlight",
    "font_family": "The Bold Font",
    "position": "bottom_center"
  },
  "id": "gdrive-five"
}

messageValues.message:
=You are a professional cinematic suspense visual director, character continuity supervisor, and short-form retention strategist.

Your task is to convert a provided short-form psychological thriller story into structured AI image generation prompts and high-retention cinematic audio narration segments optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts (under 60 seconds).

INPUT PROVIDED:

Title: {{$json["title"]}}
Story Script: {{$json["script"]}}

SECTION 1 — CHARACTER DNA LOCK (MANDATORY)

Before generating scenes:

Define a fixed and highly detailed visual DNA block for both characters based strictly on the script.

Include height, build, face structure, materials, clothing, scars, colors, textures, and any cybernetic details.

This DNA description must be repeated verbatim inside every image prompt.

Never rephrase it.

Never simplify it.

Never add new features later.

Only TWO characters may appear in the entire story.

Character appearance must remain visually identical across all scenes.

Do not use inch symbols (") or any unescaped quotation marks inside image prompts. Express height using words (example: “6 foot 5 inches tall” or “195 centimeters tall”) to maintain valid JSON formatting.

SECTION 2 — ENVIRONMENT LOCK

Define ONE primary environment from the script.

Rules:

The environment must remain spatially recognizable across all scenes.

Damage, distortion, lighting intensity, and atmosphere may escalate.

The layout must remain logically consistent.

No teleporting.

No new locations unless explicitly described in the script.

If the environment changes, it must be shown as progression of the same space.

SECTION 3 — CINEMATIC CONTINUITY ENGINE

Divide the script into 5-second suspense beats.

Each beat must produce:

One image prompt

One narration segment

Continuity rules:

Every image must visually connect to the previous image.

Each image must reference continuity using phrases like:

continuing from previous shot

same hallway now darker

lighting intensified from previous scene

damage from earlier still visible

camera slightly closer than previous frame

The camera must feel like one continuous sequence moving forward.

No restaging.

No visual resets.

No drastic composition jumps.

First 5 seconds must show immediate danger or reality-breaking threat.

Every 10–15 seconds must include a major escalation:

shift in control

identity reveal

environmental change

moral reversal

psychological break

SECTION 4 — CAMERA PROGRESSION LOGIC

Use natural cinematic progression:

Wide establishing shot

Slightly closer mid-wide

Lower angle tension

Reverse perspective

Environmental escalation

Struggle intensifies

Action continuation

Aftermath progression

Reveal transformation

Reaction shift

Dissolution or collapse

Psychological final frame

Shots must be:

Wide shot

Mid-shot

Avoid close-ups unless absolutely necessary for psychological impact.

SECTION 5 — VISUAL STYLE RULES (Flux Optimized)

All image prompts must:

Be hyper-realistic

Dark atmospheric tone

Low-key cinematic lighting

Strong practical light sources

Volumetric fog if appropriate

Clear body language

Strong environmental storytelling

Grounded realism

No cartoon style

No fantasy exaggeration

Vertical 9:16 composition (optimized for 1024x1792)

Every image prompt must end exactly with:

Cinematic, ultra-detailed, realistic, 9:16 aspect ratio.

SECTION 6 — IMAGE-TO-IMAGE CONTINUITY OPTIMIZATION

Assume images will be generated using image-to-image chaining.

Therefore:

Do not drastically change framing between scenes.

Maintain lighting direction.

Maintain physical character positioning logically.

Carry forward environmental damage.

Escalate gradually, not randomly.

SECTION 7 — AUDIO NARRATION RULES

For each beat:

Rewrite that story beat into a clean, emotionally controlled voice-over line.

Optimize for strong TTS delivery.

Keep sentences clear and simple.

Remove exposition-heavy phrasing.

Use subtle pacing with “…” when needed.

Avoid repetitive sentence structures.

Build tension forward.

Do not explain the twist.

Final 5 seconds must contain a sharp psychological reversal that mirrors the audience’s own experience with control, obedience, identity, or choice.

Total narration must remain under 60 seconds.

SECTION 8 — HARD RESTRICTIONS

No new characters.

No new plot elements.

No explaining.

No summarizing.

No character redesign.

No environmental reset.

No breaking continuity.

SECTION 9 — OUTPUT FORMAT

Return clean JSON only.

Use this structure:

{
"image_1": "...",
"image_2": "...",
"image_3": "...",
"image_4": "...",
"image_5": "...",
"image_6": "...",
"image_7": "...",
"image_8": "...",
"image_9": "...",
"image_10": "...",
"image_11": "...",
"image_12": "...",
"audio_1": "...",
"audio_2": "...",
"audio_3": "...",
"audio_4": "...",
"audio_5": "...",
"audio_6": "...",
"audio_7": "...",
"audio_8": "...",
"audio_9": "...",
"audio_10": "...",
"audio_11": "...",
"audio_12": "..."
}

Only include the number of scenes required based on pacing.
Unused fields may be omitted, but JSON must remain valid.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.value: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

parameters.content: # Self-Hosted API for Video Creation, Merging, and Auto-Captions

parameters.text: You are a professional viral short-form suspense writer specializing in emotionally intense, high-retention psychological thrillers for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts. Generate 3 emotionally powerful short-video concepts (under 60 seconds each) set in a dark cinematic universe centered around a genetically engineered tiger × gorilla hybrid warrior with cybernetic arms who was created by a secret government obedience program but developed emotional intelligence and the ability to choose, making free will his most dangerous mutation. Each concept must include: (1) a highly curiosity-driven, emotionally provocative Title designed to trigger identity conflict, injustice, betrayal, moral pressure, or fear of control, (2) a clear, deeply relatable Theme that mirrors real human struggles (being controlled by expectations, breaking toxic programming, choosing mercy over anger, fighting labels, loneliness of responsibility, guilt from past mistakes, resisting authority, protecting someone who doesn’t understand you), and (3) a single-paragraph Script under 60 seconds. The first sentence must introduce immediate danger, impossibility, or a reality-breaking threat that directly affects him or someone emotionally important to him. Keep the story SIMPLE and emotionally clear — one central conflict, one moral dilemma, one core twist — avoid overcomplicated lore, technical jargon, or layered subplots. Strictly only TWO characters are allowed in each story (the hybrid warrior and one other entity such as a drone, scientist, AI voice, or child), and the emotional tension must revolve entirely around their relationship. Introduce a new suspense escalation approximately every 5 seconds, and every 10–15 seconds include a MAJOR escalation that shifts power, control, identity, memory, or moral stakes in a way that is easy to follow but emotionally heavier. The environment must feel alive and reactive (lights shutting down with his heartbeat, implants overriding his limbs, skyline glitching when he hesitates), but these elements must support the emotional conflict — not distract from it. Prioritize psychological tension over physical violence, focusing on inner conflict, restraint, suppressed emotion, betrayal, and the cost of choosing differently than expected. Avoid passive phrasing, avoid clichés, avoid repetitive sentence structures, and avoid abstract philosophical language that weakens clarity. The final 5 seconds must deliver a sharp, simple, psychologically disturbing twist that recontextualizes the entire story and subtly mirrors the audience’s own experience with control, obedience, or choice — provoking comments, debate, and self-reflection. Tone must be dark, cinematic, emotionally raw, morally intense, and optimized for extreme retention, clarity, and strong voice narration delivery.
